summary_chunk: A woman had witnessed an argument between two McCarthys near Boscombe Pool. Shortly after, the son, McCarthy, rushed to a lodge claiming that his father was dead in the wood, asking for help. He was found to be covered in blood but had no gun or hat. The father's body was found nearby, beaten with a blunt weapon. Evidence suggested that the son's gun, found nearby, could have been the murder weapon, leading to the young McCarthy's arrest. At the inquest, a verdict of wilful murder was returned and he was put in front of the magistrates at Ross. However, some people, including Miss Turner, the daughter of a neighbouring landowner, believe in his innocence and have got a detective, Lestrade, involved. Lestrade, confused by the case, has asked for Holmes's assistance, leading the two men to travel westward to investigate the case.
